body: add info for native code to retrieve
Test comment
Thanks @Lexholden and @ddutta :)
pull request on dev package instead
One commit
@bigdata-memory updated the title of PR #57

Please use rebase instead of pull to keep the git log clean. the pull merge could be revoked by git reset using --hard option and then git fetch -a, finally use git rebase to rebase your code from Apache project repos.
Please [Visit this](http://mnemonic.incubator.apache.org/docs/submitchanges.html) for detailed steps, Thanks!
@bigdata-memory Thanks for sharing the doc [submit changes](http://mnemonic.incubator.apache.org/docs/submitchanges.html)
withdraw
Changed checked by committer, ok to merge.
Hi Rakesh, Could you please remove the first commit in this PR ?
I've rebased the PR and pushed the changes to my fork. Please let me know your feedback. Thanks!
Changes have made according to the suggestion. Please review. Thanks!
Please rebase your PR again, Thanks!
rebase done, please approve
Hi @weiho1122 please merge commits from upstream and then apply your changes to PR, Thanks!
Please rebase your PR
Will create a new request with clean commits
Will create a new PR
Hi, @jerryZh65 please ensure only 1 commit to this PR, Thanks.
Hi @jerryZh65, please rebase your PR, thanks.

Hi @taojieterry , Thank you for contributing code to our community and could you please update the commit message using "MNEMONIC-457: Add method getSize() to DurableArray", this way can help us to locate the JIRA tickets quickly by the commit history, thanks!
Looks good. @taojieterry  Please change the commit message as suggested.
+1. Looks good.
Sorry I have merged the MNEMONIC-520 first, so could you please adjust this commit based on the latest commit of upstream? thanks.
@bigdata-memory Sure I will do it now.
@bigdata-memory Please check now?

Hi Afrin, thanks for the PR.
Please squash all commits to one with the comment as "MNEMONIC-515: PMDK based Persistent Memory Service"
@afrinjamanbd PR looks very good. I have added some minor comments so that you can improve the code a bit.

Hi Folks,

Any update on this?

Regards
Kevin
@djkevincr looks no response from @afrinjamanbd , I will take care of this onward, Thanks you very much for the review.
@bigdata-memory Thank you for the message. That's fine take your time. Please let me know, if you need some help.
Thanks, but looks it didn't pass the building, it seems need to "import org.testng.Assert" in source file mnemonic-core/src/test/java/org/apache/mnemonic/PMDKVolatileMemAllocatorNGTest.java, thanks.
"import org.testng.Assert"  added in source file mnemonic-core/src/test/java/org/apache/mnemonic/PMDKVolatileMemAllocatorNGTest.java. And the issue resolved. Thanks!
Could you please squash 3 commits to one ? thanks.
Commits squashed completed. Thanks.

> Commits squashed completed. Thanks.

Thanks.
It shows unidentified pthread_create(...) when linking the native libraries.
This improvement can save the building time and make it stable along with the latest release version of pmem libraries.

The history of issues are still there.
[(https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/MNEMONIC)]

@lcy0816, could you remove the white-spaces from line 54 ? 
you can use the following command to do quick commit
```git commit --fixup HEAD```
and then push it, Thanks.
Thanks, will upgrade and fix the the vulnerability
will do, thanks to @yzz127  @bigdata-memory for your comments
We have updated the logback version to 1.1.11. @bigdata-memory please close this issue. Thanks!
This issue has been resolved, so close it.
all right, new pull request submitted
Yes, somehow it got messed up. I have updated the PR. Thanks.
Create build.gradle for subproject mnemonic-common. Thanks.
The Travis-ci stopped due to "The job exceeded the maximum log length, and has been terminated."
PR updated based on the decision to move DurableType to mnemonic-common. Please review, thanks!
Add another PR
MNEMONIC-643 is merged, and it should solve this CI error. Please trigger the CI again. Thanks

Sorry, It would rely on ticket MNEMONIC-645 as well, We expect there are other issues once applied this PR. I think it could be better if we have another topic branch to merge the JDK14 related PRs and merge it to main branch when it got stabilized.
Agreed with Gary, will merge this PR
I think we may need to update this issue as our current target is to support JDK14 instead of version 11
Ok to merge, issue related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MNEMONIC-651
We plan to resolve this issue in our 0.16.0 release
JDK14 upgrade is done, and this issue is no longer valid
I agree, thank you for tracking this.

This feature is expected to add a Redis backed memory service for durable objects. the memory persistent API needs to get satisfied. In addition, it is special as it extends the durable object placement from local to cluster.
It is great to explore this possiblity, thanks.
This PR can build on my local machine, so the failing check might be caused by other factors, I think it could be possible to merge it first, thanks.
Ok, will identify the issue after code merge.
Docker environment needs get updates to remove the building error, approve the PR now
It seems you have missed the commit message details. Please check the contribution guideline and add the information for your next commit. Thanks

Thanks for reminding! I will have the information in the next commit.

Best,
Li

> Code changes looks good, please add JIRA ticket details in the PR request so that it is easy to track the PR and issue. Please refer other PR and leave a comment if you have any question. Thanks!

PR title updated with details. Sorry I misunderstood your previous comment and thought the title with issue ID is enough...

> Looks good. For the stabilities concern though, it is better to fix the version instead of always pulling from the latest update.

Good point. Let me update the PR.

Yes, it causes the following warning: 
non-varargs call of varargs method with inexact argument type for last parameter.
It's not a [unchecked] warning. I just found this one when working on this PR, so also fixed it.
We integrate pmalloc package into the project, and have updated target integrated version for Spark and Hadoop.
It seems we have most of the bugs fixed targeting for our 0.16.0 release. @bigdata-memory could you please review if there is any other test cases that need to get fixed? Thanks!
The build error is expected due to lacking the libhiredis dependency, which will be fixed by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MNEMONIC-713
Hi Yanhui, I have modified my commit history so there are no merges now. Please review again. - Bing
Let's close it here and submit issue in Apache JIRA if any, thanks.

> The changes look good, but we will need to configure the xml for the whole project instead of just one module. Could you please make the changes for other modules as well? Thanks

Thanks for the feedback. I updated the PR with other required changes. Please take a look. Thanks.
It has been outdated, so let's close it for now, thanks.
The build failed, but passed in my local sandbox. I am looking into it. Thanks.
As @yzz127 pointed out, failure was due to spark-kmeans-bench module. It has been disabled. In addition, more spark-related items have been disabled in tests and source-assembling settings. Thanks.

It seems that there are some test cases which relies on this memory library, we have to clean up the those dependencies problems as well.
But I found it is quite difficult to have a replacement of this memory service, so I would suggest that we can de-prioritize this issue and discuss it in next community meeting, thanks.
Need to clean up dependencies first. Close the pull request for now.
LGTM
Merged.
Yes, I notice that as well, I think it might be solved in non-intrusive approach later.

The file Cargo.lock should be ignored for libraries, tracked for binaries.
So I think we may reject this PR, thanks.
Looks there is a conflict with previous commit, please resolve it, thanks.
You can rebase your local git repo with latest commit of upstream repo and then push it with option "-f", thanks.
Please remove the commit of #792 from this PR first, thanks.
